org.jetel.component

Class InfobrightDataWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.graph.Node
        • org.jetel.component.InfobrightDataWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, IGraphElement, CloverWorkerListener

    public class InfobrightDataWriter
extends Node

    Infobright Data Writer Component

    Component:

    Name:

    		 Infobright data writer

    Category:

    		 Bulk loaders

    Description:

    		 Loads data to Infobright database

    Inputs:

    		 [0] - input records.

    Outputs:

    		 [0] - optionally one output port connected - for debugging purpose. Records as they were sent to database.Comma must be set as delimiter for each field, System.getProperty("line.separator") must be set as record delimiter. Date fields must have yyyy-MM-dd format for dates and yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format for dates with time.

    Comment:

    		 If the hostname is "localhost" or "127.0.0.1" then the load will be done using a local pipe. Otherwise it will use a remote pipe. The external IP address of the server is not recognized as a local server. If loading to a remote server, then you need to start the Infobright remote load agent on the server where Infobright is running. The command to do this is: java -jar infobright-core-3.0-remote.jar [-p port] [-l loglevel] The output can be redirected to a log file. The port defaults to 5555. The loglevel can be one of: "info", "error", "debug".
    To run this component on Windows, infobright_jni.dll must be present in the Java library path (infobright-core-3.0-remote.zip).

    XML attributes:
    type"INFOBRIGHT_DATA_WRITER"
    idcomponent identification
    tabletable name in database for loading data.
    dbConnectionid of the Database Connection object to be used to access the database
    dataFormat
    optional    		bh_dataformat supported by Infobright. Available values:
    • txt_variable
    • binary - faster but works with IEE only
    charset
    optional    		the character set to use to encode String values for CHAR, VARCHAR column types. Default is Defaults.DataFormatter.DEFAULT_CHARSET_ENCODER
    logFile
    optional    		path to debug file. Records as they were sent to database. This attribute has higher priority then output port, i.e. if logFile is set and output port is connected no data is sent to output port.
    timeout
    optional    		timeout for load command. Has effect only on Windows platform.
    cloverFields
    optional    		delimited list of input record's fields. Only listed fields (in the order they appear in the list) will be considered for mapping onto target table's fields.
    checkValues
    optional    		Should strings and binary types be checked for size before being passed to the database? Default is false. (Should be set to true if you support a dubugging).
    agentPort
    optional    		Port the remote agent is listening on (see #comment).

    Example:

    <Node cloverFields="boolField;dateField;decimalField;stringField" dataFormat="txt_variable" dbConnection="JDBC1" 
  id="INFOBRIGHT_DATA_WRITER0" table="test1" type="INFOBRIGHT_DATA_WRITER"/>
    Remote loading: 
    <Node agentPort="6666" dbConnection="JDBC2" id="INFOBRIGHT_DATA_WRITER0" table="test" type="INFOBRIGHT_DATA_WRITER"/>

      • checkConfig

        public ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the IGraphElement.init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.
        Specified by:

      • init

        public void init()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Initialization of the graph element. This initialization is done exactly once at the start of the existence of this graph element. All resources which are intended to remain allocated during the whole time of the graph existence (including time between each graph run), should be allocated in this method. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.free() method.

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use IGraphElement.firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the IGraphElement.init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        preExecute in class Node
        Throws:

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for a single graph run. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.preExecute() method should be released here. It is guaranteed that this method is invoked after graph finish at the latest. For some graph elements, for instance components, is this method called immediately after phase finish.
        Specified by:
        postExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        postExecute in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with success - Result.FINISHED_OK. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if all graph processing was completely successful. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        commit in class GraphElement

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with error or was aborted - Result.ERROR, Result.ABORTED. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if some part of graph failed. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        rollback in class GraphElement
